DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Bone Marrow Fibrosis Reticulum Staining Method Finding
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._The tissue occupying the spaces of bone. It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes._The growth of fibrous tissue._Smallest forestomach of ruminants with complex honeycomb folding of mucosa._Any of the various methods that use a dye, reagent, or other material for producing coloration in tissues or microorganisms for microscopic examination._Clinical, laboratory or molecular evidence, or absence of evidence of disease.

It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes.:The growth of fibrous tissue.:Smallest forestomach of ruminants with complex honeycomb folding of mucosa.:Any of the various methods that use a dye, reagent, or other material for producing coloration in tissues or microorganisms for microscopic examination.:Clinical, laboratory or molecular evidence, or absence of evidence of disease.

Concepts.definition: The tissue occupying the spaces of bone. It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes.
The formation of fibrous tissue.
Smallest forestomach of ruminants with complex honeycomb folding of mucosa.
Any of the various methods that use a dye, reagent, or other material for producing coloration in tissues or microorganisms for microscopic examination.
Clinical, laboratory or molecular evidence, or absence of evidence of disease.
